channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned Car, 13th January
item.description:
There is a car that has not moved for around 5 months. Although it is taxed, there has been no MOT (therefore no insurance) since September 2025. The registration is CF16 BZE
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eversley Cross, North End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Fly/tip is at side of property. There’s another sofa on the main road leading to Wentworth.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wentworth Close, Greater London

item.title: Deep pothole in the centre of the road at the junction with Penhill Rd., 13th January
item.description:
The pothole has been there for years and is getting larger. It primarily constitutes a hazard to pedestrians as it is in your path as you walk along Penhill and cross the end of Howard Avenue. It is so deep that if your foot went into it you would trip. It needs yo be filled.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 177, Penhill Road, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Large pothole needs to be filled in outside house number 54

item.title: Every weekend Adults with children are coming in medway road entrance to Stonham park on trials bikes, 13th January
item.description:
Every weekend since Christmas trials bikes are churning up this park.Harassing dog walkers and putting them in grave danger. Several people many who are elderly use this park everyday on a regular basis. Worst thing ever done was installing new easy access gate in Medway road . It gives all and sundry the opportunity to take advantage. Please stop this behaviour before a person or animal gets severely injured or killed .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensbourne Road, Barnes Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yellow council obstruction boards, 13th January
item.description:
These have not been collected after work finished and keep falling over causing obstruction on road and pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Blenheim Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped along the pavement outside the school, 13th January
item.description:
Lots of rubbish food waste and black sacks. More is getting dumped because people see it there and just don’t care so dump more it is igly to look at and is getting worse. Boxes also dumped by the lamppost post the whole road is full of rubbish no one cares it anyone

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Purrett Road, Plumstead

item.title: Flooding needs fix, 13th January
item.description:
The road behind the Parkway bus stop gets flooded even with a light drizzle. This stretch is frequently used by schoolchildren, whose shoes get soaked in the rainwater. It has been a recurring issue for quite some time now. We would greatly appreciate it if this could be addressed soon. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yarnton Way, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge pothole, 13th January
item.description:
Huge dangerous pothole that made a tremendous noise that should have caused serious damage
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Entrance to 66 queens crescent, 13th January
item.description:
Ref: 8678756 My previous request was marked as closed due to it not being the councils responsibility. While I understand that the area is on private land, the works have been completed on the entire width of the pavement and we’ve been left with an issue we didn’t have before. I would like to request that this be looked at again. In addition there are multiple spots across the pavement where water does not run off correctly leaving puddles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bassett Street, Gospel Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped items, 13th January
item.description:
Hook Lane on the stretch between the junction of Westwood Lane and and Yorkland Avenue. 5 black bags of household rubbish on the corner. 1 cement slab by the letter box. 1 large glass 3 tier television stand by the bus stop. For the record flytipping along this stretch is becoming regular.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lyall Avenue, Dulwich, Greater London

item.title: Blcoked drain on corner of Euston road / Upper woburn place outside Prezzo, 13th January
item.description:
Whenever it rains the drain at the above location gets blocked and the water spreads all over the pavement and its extremely dangerous and can not walk on it, so have to walk in the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Euston Square, St Pancras, Greater London
